metadata.titel_preek: Ephesus: The Church That Left Its First Love

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (the hearer) must maintain or return to its 'first love' (Jesus) to avoid the removal of its power and status.

subject.identificatie: The Hearer / The Church ('You and I')
tekstueel_bewijs: We need to develop now a rhetoric of reconciliation.
You have left the center around which a Christian life... has to be organized.
You hitch your car to the Jesus train.
I'll take your power away from you.
If you want a formula for success, I'm going to give it to you.
The Lord who moves among the candlesticks has some words for the church.
The church ought to be dedicated to the needs of people.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Subject (The one who must act to save the candlestick)

tekstueel_bewijs: Hitch your car to the Jesus train.
Put his name in it, and I know it is bound to succeed.
helper.rol_van_god: Helper (God is the engine/power source for the human Subject's car)
helper.rol_van_geest: External help ('Holy Ghost power' as a fuel)

tekstueel_bewijs: If you are comfortable in your failure... then the Lord is not in you.
The Nicolaitans believed... you had no obligation to live a godly life.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the hearer's own lack of 'tension' or 'anguish' regarding their failures.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Social and political reconciliation in the city of Brooklyn.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church/Citizens
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A livable arrangement / Rhetoric of reconciliation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon suggests that if the church (Subject) hitches to Jesus (Helper), it will achieve the Object of social healing.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord says to the church...
I will come unto thee quickly.
God knows a church ought to be that.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We need to develop now a rhetoric...
You hitch your car to the Jesus train.

voorbeelden: The church ought to be dedicated to the needs of people.
We ought not ever become content with being less.
If you want a formula for success...
There ought to live in us a tension and an anguish.
I'm going to tell you how to get it done.
Hitch your car... you'll get to the place.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir) and motivation (Vouloir). Grace is presented as the power (Pouvoir) that the human subject must choose to 'hitch' onto.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S1 (praise for works) to ~S1 (the lack of love), threatening S2 (removal) unless the subject moves back to S1 via 'hitching'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is conditional: If the human subject hitches to the 'Jesus train', S2 is avoided.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The removal of the candlestick is treated as a loss of institutional/personal success.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While Jesus is mentioned frequently, he functions actantially as a 'Helper' (the train) or a 'Sender' (the judge) rather than the 'Subject' of the salvation. The hearer is the primary actor who must 'hitch', 'repent', and 'work'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Hitch your car to the Jesus train.
If you don't repent... I'll take your power from you.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ, that is the center, that is the core.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul, John, and Timothy are used as 'stars' to validate the church's status, and the preacher uses himself as a model of 'hitching'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how Christ sustains a church despite its failing love, rather than the church sustaining itself by 'hitching' to Christ.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform and maintain emotional 'anguish' to prove spiritual life.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is synergistic; the human must maintain the connection for the power to flow.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical Ephesus to the social needs of Brooklyn is rhetorically smooth but actantially disjointed.
spanning_punten: The 'Jesus train' metaphor clashes with the 'Judge' persona of Revelation 2.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: There ought to live in us a tension and an anguish that we ought to be more and more like Jesus.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is 'Power' (Pouvoir) that the Subject accesses to achieve success.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate; sin is 'moral collapse' or 'losing savor' rather than cosmic death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon positions the hearer as the Subject who must utilize Jesus (Helper) to achieve success (Object) and satisfy the Judge (Sender).

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the driver of the car; Jesus is just the engine.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject who seeks and restores the lost love of His bride.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You hitch your car to Jesus,' use 'Jesus has reached down to pull your stalled car into His own glory.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'worker' who must not be 'paralyzed'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the church as the 'Object' of Christ's love rather than the 'Subject' of the loving.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on Christ's 'Savoir-faire' in keeping the lampstand lit even when we are weak.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Define the 'Opponent' as the spiritual death that only a Resurrection (not a 'hitch') can fix.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Deepens the need for Grace over mere 'help'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (social work) is fused with Soteriology (hitching to Jesus).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Christ holds the church (Soteriology). 2. Therefore, the church serves the city (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has high rhetorical energy and a clear Christological focus, but structurally it remains anthropocentric by making Jesus the instrument of human success.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'Jesus train' is a powerful metaphor; actantially, it reduces the Savior to a utility.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis notes the text's warning; semiotics reveals that the preacher places the burden of 'power' on the hearer's 'hitching' action.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that despite the 'Jesus' vocabulary, the 'Subject' of the verbs remains 'We' and 'You'.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon is a classic example of 'Recruitment' modal competence, trying to move the hearer's 'Vouloir' (Will).
